title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act by adding a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The Secretary must develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for children and adults, as well as include all vaccines recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The Secretary must develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, and other vaccines designated by the Secretary for public health preparedness efforts. The Secretary shall carry out the supply authority using specified provisions and any other relevant authority. The Secretary must submit a plan for purchasing vaccines to specific Senate and House committees within 6 months of enactment. The plan should discuss the basis and prioritization of vaccine purchases. Implementation of the plan must be completed by September 30. The Secretary must fully implement the vaccine purchasing plan by September 30, 2008. Manufacturers must provide at least 1 year notice to the Secretary before discontinuing vaccine production, with the option to reduce the notice period under certain conditions. The Secretary must implement the vaccine purchasing plan by September 30, 2008. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines. Ongoing reports on plan implementation progress and any impediments must be submitted periodically. The Secretary must implement the vaccine purchasing plan by September 30, 2008. Reports must include recommendations on extending vaccine supply and discussions on the reasons behind the recommendations. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
